Intercepted messages encrypted with RSA leaked half of one private key. Can you recover the secret and reveal the message? Ciphertext: 270384051024413321843661141465063413020951513843223763439856618106228004580954726212893253472561233289708846512505648779698437003189594837123741846529327

The flag format is flag{...}
n=5722050372069327708342778035425624867248261207618056566604484569746866962074186764653143188401391736098252312121238493810963471153836169197612464650384273, e=2217202692966867805057332784243063595788860676272865132459193917770855399379675602992143686590416368130579852944679609434039367345920424223730127784287833, partial_p=15638114986221954184

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{95fsxbx6}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 270384051024413321843661141465063413020951513843223763439856618106228004580954726212893253472561233289708846512505648779698437003189594837123741846529327
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=5722050372069327708342778035425624867248261207618056566604484569746866962074186764653143188401391736098252312121238493810963471153836169197612464650384273, e=2217202692966867805057332784243063595788860676272865132459193917770855399379675602992143686590416368130579852944679609434039367345920424223730127784287833, partial_p=15638114986221954184
extra_info: p=98162038718190287955293172036619142089897040947891128875528093334799783285709, q=58291886016105954370858878735654237495085812320217401028392379554357670224597, Ï†(n)=5722050372069327708342778035425624867248261207618056566604484569746866962074030310728408892159065584047480038741653510957695362623932248724723307196873968
subtype: partial_key_exposure
